subclassFeature.name: Dungeoneer
entries: Während sich die meisten Handwerker auf eine Erfindung konzentrieren, nutzen Kerkermeister ihr Wissen, um profane Gegenstände zu Waffen zu machen. Im Vertrauen darauf, dass sie unermessliche Reichtümer und mächtige Artefakte beschützen, verwenden diese geschickten Erfinder einfache Abenteurerausrüstung, um defensive Fallen, Rätsel und Strukturen zu konstruieren, die alle außer den härtesten und entschlossensten Abenteurern und Marodeuren abwehren können.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: Wenn du auf Stufe 3 ein Kerkermeister-Spezialist wirst, erhältst du die Beherrschung von {@item carpenter's tools|phb|carpenter's} und {@item smith's tools|phb}. Wenn du bereits Schreiner- oder Schmiedewerkzeuge beherrschst, erhältst du ein weiteres Set von {@item artisan's tools|phb} deiner Wahl.

Du erlangst außerdem Fertigkeit im Umgang mit improvisierten Waffen. Wenn du einen Angriff mit einer improvisierten Waffe ausführst, kannst du deine Intelligenz anstelle von Stärke oder Geschicklichkeit für die Angriffs- und Schadenswürfe verwenden, und der Schadenswürfel für alle Angriffe mit improvisierten Waffen, die du ausführst, wird zu einem d8, wenn er niedriger wäre.

entries.caption: Dungeoneer Spells
rows: {@spell glyph of warding}, {@spell Leomund's tiny hut|phb|tiny hut}
{@spell guardian of faith}, {@spell Otiluke's resilient sphere|phb|resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Dungeoncraft
entries: Ab Stufe 3 kannst du jedes Mal, wenn du eine lange Pause beendest, eine Anzahl von Gegenständen deiner Wahl aus der untenstehenden Tabelle herstellen, die deinem Intelligenzmodifikator entspricht (mindestens 1 Gegenstand). Sie erscheinen als weltliche Versionen dieser Gegenstände, verwandeln sich aber in der nächsten Morgendämmerung nach ihrer Herstellung in Asche. Du kannst normale Versionen dieser Gegenstände in einem Viertel der Zeit herstellen.
Wenn ein Gegenstand, den du mit dieser Eigenschaft herstellst, eine Kreatur dazu zwingt, einen Rettungswurf zu machen, verwenden sie deinen Zauber-Save-DC des Artificers.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Ab der 5. Stufe kannst du zweimal statt einmal angreifen, wenn du die Aktion "Angriff" in deinem Zug ausführst.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Improvisation
entries: Ab der 9. Stufe gelten deine Angriffe mit improvisierten Waffen und Gegenstände der Kerkerkunst als magisch, um Widerstand und Immunität gegen nichtmagische Angriffe zu überwinden.
Außerdem kannst du einmal pro langer Ruhezeit einen deiner Kerkermeister-Zauber wirken, ohne die materielle Komponente bereitzustellen.

subclassFeature.name: Master Dungeoneer
entries: Du bist ein Meister der Kerkerkunde geworden. Ab Stufe 15 haben Kreaturen bei Rettungswürfen für deine Dungeoncraft-Objekte und Dunegoneer-Zauber einen Nachteil.

Außerdem lernst du, eine rituelle Version der beiden Zauber {@spell passwall} und {@spell wall of stone} zu wirken. Das Wirken dieser Zauber dauert 1 Stunde, verbraucht keinen Zauberslot und die erschaffene Struktur wird am Ende des Rituals dauerhaft.

subclassFeature.name: Aeronaut
entries: Eine der gefährlichsten Obsessionen, die ein Handwerker verfolgen kann, war schon immer der mechanische Flug. Viele streben nach diesem hochgesteckten Ziel, und alle außer den engagiertesten und oft auch tollkühnsten Künstlern scheitern bei ihren Versuchen. Experimente, die in katastrophalen Explosionen, katastrophalen Abstürzen und tödlichen Fehlfunktionen enden, sind für einen Aeronauten, der seine mechanische Flugmaschine perfektioniert, nichts Ungewöhnliches.
Sie sind ständig bemüht, das hohe Ziel eines jeden Aeronauten zu erreichen, nämlich eine geheimnisvolle Flugmaschine zu bauen.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: Auf Stufe 3 erhältst du die Beherrschung von {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}. Wenn du bereits die Werkzeuge eines Holzschnitzers beherrschst, erlangst du die Beherrschung einer weiteren Art von {@item artisan's tools|phb} deiner Wahl.

subclassFeature.name: Flying Machine
entries: Ab der 3. Stufe kannst du am Ende einer langen Ruhepause die Werkzeuge deines Holzschnitzers benutzen, um eine Flugmaschine zu bauen. Du wählst das Aussehen der Maschine, aber es hat keinen Einfluss auf ihre Fähigkeiten. Deine Flugmaschine hat die folgenden Eigenschaften:

items: Er kann von dir als Zauberfokus verwendet werden.
Er ist so gebaut, dass er Ihnen passt und über einer leichten Rüstung getragen werden kann.

Wenn du fällst und nicht außer Gefecht gesetzt bist, ziehst du bei der Berechnung des Fallschadens bis zu 100 Fuß von deinem Fall ab und kannst dich pro 1 Fuß, den du fällst, 2 Fuß horizontal bewegen.
Du erhältst eine Fluggeschwindigkeit von 15 Fuß, die sich mit jedem Stufenanstieg in dieser Klasse erhöht: auf Stufe 5 (20 Fuß), auf Stufe 9 (30 Fuß) und schließlich auf Stufe 15 (60 Fuß).

Wenn du einen Waffenangriff ausführst, während du dich mindestens 5 Fuß über dem Boden befindest, kannst du deine Intelligenz anstelle von Stärke oder Geschicklichkeit für die Angriffs- und Schadenswürfe verwenden.

entries: Man kann immer nur eine Flugmaschine haben, und wenn man eine weitere erschafft, geht die andere kaputt.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Ab der 5. Stufe kannst du zweimal statt einmal angreifen, wenn du die Aktion "Angriff" in deinem Zug ausführst.

subclassFeature.name: Aerial Maneuvers
entries: Ab der 9. Stufe kannst du, während du deine Flugmaschine trägst, die Aktion Sprint als Bonusaktion in deinem Zug ausführen.
Solange du deine Flugmaschine ausgerüstet hast, erhältst du außerdem einen Bonus auf deine Geschicklichkeitsprüfungen und Rettungswürfe in Höhe deines Intelligenzmodifikators (mindestens +1).

subclassFeature.name: Master Aeronaut
entries: Du bist ein Meister der Aeronauten-Kunstfertigkeit geworden. Ab Stufe 15, wenn du deine Flugmaschine trägst und einem Effekt ausgesetzt bist, der es dir erlaubt, einen Rettungswurf in Geschicklichkeit zu machen, um nur halben Schaden zu erleiden, erleidest du stattdessen keinen Schaden, wenn du erfolgreich bist, und nur halben Schaden, wenn du versagst.

subclassFeature.name: Archivist
entries: Seit Jahrhunderten suchen Chronisten nach der besten Möglichkeit, große Mengen an Informationen zu speichern. Während sich die meisten mit Schriftrollen begnügten, strebten die Archivare nach etwas Größerem. Sie haben gelernt, Informationen im Wert von Bibliotheken in einem einzigen Objekt zu speichern, und haben damit die ersten Künstlichen Gehirne erschaffen. Im Zusammenspiel mit diesen wundersamen Köpfen verfügen Archivare über die potenziell grenzenlose Macht dieser arkanen Intelligenzen.
Wie werden Sie Ihre Fähigkeit zur Schaffung künstlicher Intelligenz einsetzen?

subclassFeature.name: Artificial Mind
entries: Ab der 3. Stufe lernst du, Künstliche Geister in Gegenständen zu erwecken. Am Ende einer langen Ruhepause kannst du einen winzigen, nichtmagischen Gegenstand berühren und deine Kalligraphieutensilien benutzen, um ein Künstliches Bewusstsein in ihm zu erwecken. Solange der Künstliche Geist in einem Gegenstand erweckt ist, gilt er als magischer Gegenstand, der eine Einstimmung erfordert, und kann als Zauberfokus für deine Kunstfertigkeitszauber verwendet werden. Wenn du versuchst, einen zweiten Künstlichen Geist zu erwecken, während du bereits einen aus dieser Eigenschaft besitzt, hört der erste Künstliche Geist auf zu existieren. Während du auf deinen Künstlichen Verstand eingestimmt bist, erhältst du die folgenden Fähigkeiten:

entries.name: Information Overload
entries: Du kannst deinen Künstlichen Verstand dazu bringen, den Verstand deiner Feinde zu überlasten, indem du ihnen Informationen zuführst. Als Aktion kannst du eine Kreatur in einem Umkreis von 30 Fuß, die du sehen kannst, dazu zwingen, einen Rettungswurf in Intelligenz zu machen. Bei einem misslungenen Schutzwurf erleidet die Kreatur {@dice 1d8} psychischen Schaden und einen Nachteil beim nächsten Angriffswurf, den sie vor Beginn deines nächsten Zuges macht.
Der Schaden von Informationsüberlastung erhöht sich ab der 5. Stufe ({@dice 2d8}), der 11. Stufe ({@dice 3d8}) und der 17.

entries.name: Magical Telephony
entries: Du kannst mit jeder Kreatur, die einen deiner infundierten Gegenstände trägt, innerhalb eines Radius von 1 Meile telepathisch kommunizieren. Die Kreatur kann telepathisch antworten.

entries.name: Skill Proficiencies
entries: Du erlangst die Beherrschung von zwei Fertigkeiten deiner Wahl aus der Spalte in der Tabelle Künstlicher Geist. Das Material des Objekts bestimmt die Fertigkeiten, die du auswählst, da die Natur des Objekts das Wissen des Geistes beeinflusst.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the trade
entries: Wenn du auf der 3. Stufe ein Archivar-Spezialist wirst, erhältst du die Beherrschung von {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb}. Wenn du bereits Kalligraphie-Bedarf beherrschst, erhältst du stattdessen die Beherrschung einer anderen Art von {@item artisan's tools|phb} deiner Wahl.

subclassFeature.name: Acute Overload
entries: Ab der 5. Stufe kannst du einen Zauberspruch ausgeben, um den psychischen Schaden von "Informationsüberlastung" zu erhöhen. Der Schaden erhöht sich um {@dice 2d8} für einen Zauberslot der 1. Stufe und um weitere {@dice 1d8} für jede Zauberstufe über der 1.
Wenn du mit deinem Künstlichen Geist als Zauberfokus psychischen Schaden verursachst, erhältst du außerdem einen Bonus auf den Schadenswurf in Höhe deines Intelligenzmodifikators (mindestens +1).

subclassFeature.name: Improved Consciousness
entries: Die kognitiven Fähigkeiten deines Künstlichen Geistes sind mächtig genug, um deine Zauberei zu unterstützen. Ab Stufe 9 erhältst du einen Bonus auf deinen Wurf in Höhe deines Intelligenzmodifikators (mindestens +1), wenn du einen Rettungswurf der Konstitution machen musst, um die Konzentration auf einen Zauber aufrechtzuerhalten.

subclassFeature.name: Master Archivist
entries: Du bist ein Meister der archivarischen Kunstfertigkeit. Ab Stufe 15 kannst du dich mit einer deiner Aktionen in reine Information verwandeln und dich in einen unbesetzten Raum teleportieren, den du innerhalb von 60 Fuß sehen kannst, oder in einen unbesetzten Raum innerhalb von 5 Fuß um eine Kreatur oder einen Gegenstand, der eine deiner Artificer-Infusionen trägt.

subclassFeature.name: Biomancer
entries: Während sich die meisten Kunsthandwerker mit mechanischer Innovation begnügen, sehen einige die Biologie, die Wissenschaft von den Lebewesen, als ein Gebiet voller Potenzial. Biomancer sind diejenigen, die ihre Talente nutzen, um ihre eigene Anatomie zu ergänzen und Leben zu erschaffen. Durch die Kombination von Nekromantie und Transmutationsmagie betrachten Biomancer alle lebenden Dinge als Prototypen, die auf magische Weise weiterentwickelt werden können.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: Auf Stufe 3 erhältst du die Beherrschung von {@item leatherworker's tools|phb}. Wenn du bereits die Werkzeuge eines Lederhändlers beherrschst, erhältst du ein weiteres Set {@item artisan's tools|phb} deiner Wahl.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Chimera
entries: Du kannst dein Wissen über Biomantie-Magie nutzen, um eine abweichende Lebensform zu erschaffen. Ab der 3. Stufe erschaffst du jedes Mal, wenn du {@spell find familiar} wirkst, stattdessen eine Chimäre, die wie ein normaler Vertrauter funktioniert, aber die folgenden Veränderungen aufweist:

items: Die materielle Komponente ist 1 Pfund organisches Material.
Es handelt sich um eine Monstrosität (und nicht um eine himmlische, feige oder teuflische Kreatur).
Er verfügt über zusätzliche Trefferpunkte in Höhe der Stufe deines Kunsthandwerkers.

Als Aktion kann die Chimäre eine Kreatur berühren und eine beliebige Menge ihrer Trefferpunkte opfern, um das Ziel für die gleiche Menge zu heilen, indem sie ihr Fleisch auf das der Kreatur verpflanzt.

entries: Als Aktion kann die Chimäre mit einer Kreatur verschmelzen, die sie berühren kann, wodurch sie ihr vorübergehend Trefferpunkte in Höhe der verbleibenden Trefferpunkte der Chimäre verleiht. Während der Verschmelzung erhält das Ziel eine der unten aufgeführten Chimären-Eigenschaften. Die Kreaturen bleiben so lange miteinander verschmolzen, bis du eine andere Chimäre erschaffst oder die temporären Trefferpunkte aufgebraucht sind, woraufhin die Chimäre zerstört wird.

entries.name: Amphibious Physiology
entries: Während der Verschmelzung kann die Kreatur sowohl Luft als auch Wasser atmen und erhält eine Schwimmgeschwindigkeit von 30 Fuß.

entries.name: Resilient Hide
entries: Wenn die Kreatur verschmolzen ist und keine Rüstung oder einen Schild trägt, ist ihre Rüstungsklasse gleich 10 + dein Intelligenzmodifikator + ihr Konstitutionsmodifikator.

entries.name: Vestigial Limb
entries: Während der Verschmelzung wächst der Kreatur ein zusätzliches Glied, das ihren eigenen Gliedmaßen ähnelt. Es hat eine Reichweite von 5 Fuß und kann eine Anzahl von Pfund heben, die deinem Intelligenzwert entspricht. Das Glied kann keine Waffen oder Schilde benutzen und kann auch nichts tun, was manuelle Präzision erfordert.

subclassFeature.name: Augmented Flesh
entries: Die Macht deiner Chimäre funktioniert am besten, wenn sie mit ihrem Meister verschmolzen ist. Ab der 5. Stufe erhältst du die folgenden Vorteile, wenn du mit deiner Aberrant-Chimäre verschmolzen bist:

items: Immer wenn du einen Angriffs- oder Schadenswurf, eine Fähigkeitsprüfung oder einen Rettungswurf machst, für den du normalerweise deine Stärke verwenden würdest, kannst du stattdessen deine Intelligenz einsetzen.

Du erhältst eine Klettergeschwindigkeit, die deiner Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit entspricht, und kannst schwierige Oberflächen erklimmen, auch kopfüber an der Decke, ohne eine Fähigkeitsprüfung abzulegen.

Als Bonusaktion kannst du einen Zauberschlitz ausgeben, um dir temporäre Trefferpunkte in Höhe des Fünffachen der Stufe des Zauberschlitzes + deines Intelligenzmodifikators zu verleihen. Diese temporären Trefferpunkte werden zu allen temporären Trefferpunkten addiert, die du durch die Verschmelzung mit deiner Aberrant Chimera hast.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Außerdem kannst du ab der 5. Stufe zweimal statt einmal angreifen, wenn du die Aktion "Angriff" in deinem Zug ausführst.

subclassFeature.name: Strange Evolution
entries: Du hast deine eigene Physiologie mit seltsamer Magie verbessert. Auf der 9. Stufe erhöht sich dein Bewegungstempo um 10 Fuß, und du erhältst dauerhaft eine chimärische Eigenschaft deiner Wahl.
Wenn du die 15. Stufe in dieser Klasse erreichst, erhältst du eine zweite permanente Chimären-Eigenschaft deiner Wahl (insgesamt zwei).

subclassFeature.name: Master Biomancer
entries: Du bist ein Meister unter den Biomancer-Kunsthandwerkern geworden. Ab Stufe 15 kannst du, wenn du eine Kreatur mit einem Biomancer-Zauber anvisierst, einem einzelnen Ziel (zusätzliche) temporäre Trefferpunkte in Höhe deiner Stufe als Artificer gewähren.
In addition, when merged with your Chimera, you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Chronothief
entries: For those that pursue the magic of artifice, no area of study is too dangerous. Perhaps against their better judgment, some artificers choose to experiment with Chronomancy, the magic of time. Known as Chronothieves, these bold artificers are marked by their signature Chronometers, a wondrous object which they use to steal moments and adjust the flow of time.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with jeweler's tools. If you are already proficient with jeweler's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Chronometer
entries: At 3rd level, you can create a Chronometer, marking you as a true Chronothief. At the end of a long rest, you can use your jeweler's tools to construct a Tiny timekeeping device, like a watch, hourglass, or small sun dial, which can be used as a spellcasting focus by you for your artificer spells.
You can only have one Chronometer at a time, and creating another causes the magic within the first to dissipate.

Your Chronometer has a number of charges equal to twice your Intelligence modifier. It regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest. While your Chronometer is in hand, you can expend a charge to use the following abilities:

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: As an action, you increase the speed of a creature within 60 feet by a number feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: As an action, you force a creature that within 60 feet to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, its movement speed is reduced by a number feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Slip
entries: As a reaction when a creature within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can force them to re-roll. You must use this reaction before you know if the triggering attack, check, or saving throw succeed.

entries.name: Warp
entries: As an action, you can switch places with a creature within 60 feet, each instantly teleporting to the other's space. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be forced to switch places with you.

subclassFeature.name: Stolen Moments
entries: You have improved your Chronometer so that you can literally save moments in time for later. Beginning at 5th level, when you successfully paralyze, stun, or reduce a creature's movement speed to 0 with a spell or Chronothief ability, your Chronometer regains one of its expended charges.
Also, any of your Chronometer abilities that require an action to use can also be used as a bonus action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Chronomancy
entries: Your understanding and control over the magic of time has greatly increased. Upon reaching 9th level in this class, the magic of your Chronometer improves in the following ways:

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: Opportunity attacks against the target creature have disadvantage until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: You can spend an additional charge to double the movement speed reduction. If this feature reduces a target's speed to 0, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Slip
entries: You can spend two charges to use this reaction after you know if the triggering attack roll, ability check, or saving throw succeeded or failed.

entries.name: Warp
entries: You can spend additional charges to increase the range by an additional 30 feet for each charge you expend.

subclassFeature.name: Master Chronothief
entries: You are considered a master in the field of Chronomancy. Starting at 15th level, you can overload your Chronometer, expending any remaining charges, to cast {@spell time stop}.
Once you cast {@spell time stop} in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Composer
entries: Behind every great musician, every standing ovation, every sold out concert, there is most often Composer who put quill to parchment and penned the notes. These great minds are unlike other bards and entertainers, Composers take a more cerebral approach to music. They are masters of patterns and repetition, and when they apply their analytical minds to a problem it is only a matter of time before they find a solution.
The signature invention of every Composer is their Musical Apparatus, a totally unique invention of their own design that allows them to produce wondrous musical effects.

subclassFeature.name: Musical Apparatus
entries: At 3rd level, you create a signature musical instrument. At the end of a long rest, you can use your smith's tools to create a Musical Apparatus. You are proficient with this Apparatus and it can be used as a spellcasting focus by you. When you make an ability check with your Musical Apparatus, you can add double your proficiency bonus to the result of your roll.
You can only maintain one Apparatus at a time. If you create a second, the previous Apparatus becomes unusable.
Upon creating your Musical Apparatus, you can weaponize it, choosing one of the following options below:

entries.name: Raucous Blast
entries: Your Apparatus can assault creatures with a blast of sound. As an action, make a spell attack against a creature within 60 feet that can hear you. On hit, the creature takes {@dice 1d8} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} until the start of your next turn. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), and again at 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

entries.name: Ringing Strike
entries: Your Apparatus is a simple weapon with the versatile property, and it deals {@dice 1d8} ({@dice 1d10}) bludgeoning damage on hit. You are considered proficient with it, and you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength, for attack and damage rolls. In addition, you can cast the {@spell booming blade|TCE} cantrip as long as your Apparatus is the material component.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: When you become a Composer Specialist at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} and one instrument of your choice. If you already proficient with smith's tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderous Note
entries: Beginning at 5th level, when you hit a creature with a Musical Apparatus attack, you can expend a spell slot to knock Large or smaller targets back with a thunderous burst of sound. The creature is knocked back 10 feet for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 10 feet for each spell level higher than 1st-level.
Also, whenever you deal thunder damage, you add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to your damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Resonant Frequency
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can use an action to play a note that causes a target within 10 feet to resonate with undetectable music for 1 hour. The next time that creature is hit by a melee attack, the attacker must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 2d8} thunder damage and not be able take reactions until the start of their next turn.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master Composer
entries: You have mastered the theory and applications of musical. Beginning at 15th level, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to thunder damage and being deafened.
Your Musical Apparatus gains both Weaponized effects.
Your Thunderous Note feature effects Huge or smaller creatures. Large or smaller creatures that fail the saving throw fall prone at the end of their forced movement.
The damage of Resonant Frequency becomes {@dice 4d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Forgewright
entries: While most artificers are primarily inventors that take up a life of adventure to test experiments in the field, those known as Forgewrights seek out battle for its own sake. Reveling in the thrill of combat, they combine their innovation with their skill as warriors to forge their signature Arcane Armament.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: When you become a Forgewright Specialist at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} and all martial weapons. If you already proficient in smith's tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Armament
entries: Your intimate knowledge of warfare and arcane magic allows you to combine both with ease. Starting at 3rd level, you learn to forge an arcane armament. At the end of each long rest, you touch one melee weapon and turn it into your arcane armament, granting it the following properties:

items: The weapon you is considered magic if it was not already.
You can use your Intelligence modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
You gain a +1 bonus to your attack and damage rolls with it, unless the base weapon granted a higher bonus. This bonus increases at 9th level (+2) and at 15th level (+3).
It can bear one of your Infusions, even if it was already a magic item before becoming your Arcane Armament.
It gains the thrown property (range 20/60) and the returning property, and the weapon returns to your hand immediately after every ranged attack you make.

entries: Your Arcane Armament is usable only by you. Enchanting a second weapon causes the magic imbued the first to dispel.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Also, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Smite
entries: You can channel raw arcane power through your Armament. Beginning at 9th level, when you hit a target with your Arcane Armament you can channel arcane energy through it to create one of the following effects of your choice:

items: The target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} force damage. You can expend a spell slot to increase this damage. The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} per level of the spell slot you expend.
You gain temporary hit points equal to your artificer level.
You can force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save they are knocked prone.

entries: You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master Forgewright
entries: You have become a master among Forgewright artificers. Starting at 15th level, you can extend the power within your Arcane Armament to your allies. As an action, choose a number of weapons equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) within 30 feet. For the next minute these weapons deal an additional {@dice 1d6} force damage on hit.
You can use this feature once per long rest, unless you spend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Machinist
entries: While some artificers spend their lives perfection one solitary creation, Machinist artificer value quantity over quality. They are known for creating their signature Automatons, small clockwork men that are created for a single, but temporary purpose. Armed with their tools, and an army of strange and wondrous servants, Machinists are ready for any challenge.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}. If you already proficient in smith's tools, you gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

entries.caption: Machinist Spells
rows: {@spell cloud of daggers}, {@spell cordon of arrows}
{@spell Mordenkainen's faithful hound|phb|faithful hound}, {@spell summon construct|tce}

subclassFeature.name: Automatons
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to craft Automatons. At the end of each long rest, you use your smith's tools to magically create a Small Automaton in an unoccupied space within 5 feet. Once you create an Automaton, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until you expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to create another one. You can have one Automaton at a time, creating a second causes the first to fall apart.

Automatons are magical constructs with an Armor Class equal to 12 + your Intelligence modifier, and hit points equal to your artificer level + your Intelligence modifier. When they make an ability check or a saving throw, its ability scores are 10 (+0). If mending is cast on it, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 hour.

When you create your Automaton, you decide which type it is, choosing from the options on the table below. As a bonus action on your turn, you can activate the Automaton if you are within 60 feet. As part that bonus action, you can direct the Automaton to walk up to 25 feet to an unoccupied space.

entries.caption: Automaton Model
rows: You can see and hear through the senses of your Automaton, so long as you are within 100 feet. You are deaf and blind to your senses until you end this link as a bonus action.
The Automaton latches onto a creature within 5 feet, reducing the target's movement speed by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet).
The Automaton attaches itself to a willing creature within 5 feet. While attached, the creature's Armor Class cannot be less than 13 + your Intelligence modifier
The Automaton gains proficiency in one set of tools, and adds your Intelligence modifier to any check it makes using that set of tools.
The Automaton makes a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet. On hit, it deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Conduit
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you learn to channel magic through your Automatons. When you cast an artificer spell, you can choose for the spell to originate from an Automaton, instead of yourself so long as you are within 60 feet of it.
When you cast a spell in this way, you roll a {@dice d8}, and add the number rolled to one damage, or healing, roll of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Automated Army
entries: You can create and control Automatons even more efficiently. Starting at 5th level, you can control up to two Automatons at one time, and at the end of each long rest you can create two Automatons of your choice, without expending a spell slot. You can activate all Automatons as one bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Efficient Production
entries: Starting at 9th level, when you expend an artificer spell slot to create an Automaton, you create a number of Automatons equal to the level of the spell slot expended. You cannot use this feature to exceed your maximum number of Automatons.

subclassFeature.name: Master Machinist
entries: You have become a master amongst Machinist artificers. Starting at 15th level, you can control up to three Automatons at one time, and at the end of a long rest you create three Automatons of your choice, without expending a spell slot.

Also, when you are forced to make a saving throw or are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to switch places with one of your Automatons within 60 feet. The Automaton then becomes the target of the attack or saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Puppeteer
entries: Though all artificers have their quirks, Puppeteers tend to be the strangest subset of arcane inventors. They dedicate their research and intellect towards mastery of manipulation and control of other creatures through the use of their Marionette Strings. Often found literally pulling the strings from behind the scenes, these strange artificers prefer to empower their allies rather than risk their own lives on the front lines.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item weaver's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with weaver's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Marionette Strings
entries: At 3rd level, you learn to fashion the strange Strings that mark you as a Puppeteer. When you finish a long rest, you can use your weaver's tools to construct a set of Marionette Strings, usable only by you. As an action, you can cause your Strings to fly out and magically attach to a willing creature within 30 feet. You must have a free hand to use your Strings.

While a creature is attached to your Strings, you gain the features listed below. Your Marionette Strings detach after 1 minute, if you use a bonus action to detach them, or if you and the creature are ever more than 30 feet apart.
You can attach your Marionette Strings a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Corrected Strike
entries: When the attached creature makes a melee attack, you can use your reaction to have them re-roll their attack roll, and they must use the new roll. You must use this reaction before you know if the attack hits or misses.

entries.name: Channel Spell
entries: As an action on your turn, you can cast an artificer spell as if it originated from the attached creature. If the spell requires concentration, you concentrate on it.

entries.name: Puppeteer's Guidance
entries: When the attached creature makes an ability check that uses a skill with which you are proficient , you can grant them a bonus to their roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

entries.name: Strange Movement
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the attached creature a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet). This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Strange Strikes
entries: The degree of control you exert through your Strings grows. Starting at 5th level, when the creature attached to your Marionette Strings makes an attack, you can use your reaction to cause them to make one additional attack.

In addition, when a creature attached to your Strings hits a creature with a melee attack, you can expend a spell slot to empower their strike. Their strike deals an additional {@dice 2d6} force damage for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional {@dice 1d6} force damage for each spell slot level above 1st.

subclassFeature.name: Nimble Fingers
entries: Your ability to control and amplify the abilities of others has increased. Starting at 9th level, you can have two creatures attached to separate Marionette Strings at one time. You must have a free hand to control each of these creatures. The two creatures can be any distance apart, so long as they each individually remain within the range of your Strings.
In addition, the length of your Marionette Strings, and the range of your Puppeteer abilities, becomes 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Master Puppeteer
entries: You have become a master amongst Puppeteer artificers. Starting at 15th level, you can use an action on your turn to cast the {@spell Irresistible Dance} spell, without expending a spell slot, or requiring your concentration. You can only have once instance of this spell active at a time. When a creature makes a saving throw to resist the spell, you can expend a use of your Marionette Strings to impose disadvantage.
Once you cast {@spell Irresistible Dance} in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again, or expend a use of your Marionette Strings ability to use this ability again.

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Alchemist
entries: Alchemy is a delicate art, tip the ratio of ingredients too far out of line and the effects could be disastrous. Those that study the magic of arcane potions and brews are known as Alchemists. They are experts at combining exotic reagents to produce a variety of materials and effects. From healing droughts that can mend a wound in moments, to sticky goo that explodes when it comes in contact with open flame. With careful preparation, and a bit of luck, Alchemists are masters of both giving life and leeching it away.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}. If you are already proficient with alchemist's supplies, you gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Elixirs
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, at the end of each long rest, you can use your alchemist's supplies produce an Elixir in an empty flask you touch. At creation, you choose the Elixir's effect from the table below, some of which include your proficiency bonus (PB). The effect of an Elixir is triggered when someone drinks the Elixir. As a bonus action, a creature can drink the Elixir or administer it to a creature within 5 feet. A creature can only be under the effects of one Elixir at a time, and drinking another immediately ends any other Elixir effects.
Any Elixir you create through this feature lasts until it is consumed, or until the end of your next long rest.
As an action on your turn, you can expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to create an Elixir in an empty flask you touch. You can use the Elixir as part of the same action.
At certain levels in this class, you can make more Elixirs at the end of a long rest: at 6th level (two), and 15th level (three).

entries.caption: Alchemical Elixirs
rows: The drinker is transformed as if by the {@spell alter self} spell. They determine the effect of the spell, which lasts for 10 minutes.
The drinker can add {@dice 1d4} to any attack rolls and saving throws they make for 1 minute.
The drinker gains a flying speed equal to 5 times your PB in feet for 10 minutes.
The drinker regains a number of hit points equal to PB({@dice d4}) + your Intelligence Modifier.
The drinker gains a bonus to their Armor Class equal to half your PB for 10 minutes.
The drinker's speed increases by a number of feet equal to 5 times your PB for 1 hour.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Savant
entries: Starting at 5th level, when you cast an artificer spell that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, or restores hit points, you gain a bonus to the damage, or healing, roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Restorative Reagents
entries: Beginning at 9th level, whenever a creature drinks one of your Elixirs, they gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Intelligence modifier, in addition to the Elixir's effect.
Also, you can cast {@spell lesser restoration} without expending a spell slot, even if you don't have it prepared, provided you use your {@item alchemist's supplies|phb} as the spellcasting focus.
You can cast {@spell lesser restoration} in this way a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master Alchemist
entries: You have become a master among Alchemist artificers. Upon reaching 15th level, you gain resistance to acid and poison damage, and immunity to the {@condition poisoned} condition.

In addition, you can cast both {@spell greater restoration} and {@spell heal} without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without providing the material component, provided you use your {@item alchemist's supplies|phb} as the spellcasting focus.
You can cast each of these spells once with this feature, and you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: Adjustable Tool Set

item: a set of artisan's tools (require attunement)

entries: The wielder is considered proficient with this magical set of tools, and as an action, they can transform this set of tools into another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of their choice.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Implement
entries: This tiny length of wood is infused with an artificer cantrip of your choice. As an action, a creature can produce the imbued cantrip, using your spellcasting modifier to cast the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Arm Launcher
entries: This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object (for example: ball bearings, a vial of acid, alchemist's fire, or holy water). As a bonus action the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged attack at a target within 20 feet. The launcher can be reloaded as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Instrument
entries: This instrument has been magically enhanced by artifice. The wielder is considered proficient with this instrument and can use it as a spellcasting focus. Whenever they make an ability check using this instrument, they gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
At 10th level this magic instrument grants a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 14th level.

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Belt
entries: When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-tenth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.
At 10th level it reduces the wearer to one-hundredth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Weapon

item: A heavy or two-handed weapon (requries attunement)

entries: This magic weapon no longer has either the heavy or two-handed property (your choice upon infusion).
At 10th level this weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. This bonus becomes +2 at 14th level.

optionalfeature.name: Goggles of Clearsight

item: A pair of goggles or glasses

entries: While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through lightly obscured areas without disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks. In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects from the Sunlight Sensativity trait, and they have advantage on saving throws to resist being blinded.

optionalfeature.name: Power Whip
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it's damage die increases to {@dice 1d8}.
This bonus increases at 10th level (+2) and 14th level (+3).

optionalfeature.name: Immovable Boots
entries: When the user is standing on a flat surface, they can use an action to activate the boots, magically fixing the user in place. Until you use an action to deactivate the boots, you do not move, even if you are defying gravity.
A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating your boots from the surface on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Light Blade

item: A sword hilt or wand (requires attunement)

entries: While grasping the item, the wielder can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or dissapear, from the end of the item. While the blade exists, this magic item is a simple weapon with the finesse property. The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight.

The wielder gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals {@dice 1d8} radiant damage on hit. Undead take an additional {@dice 1d8} radiant damage. The bonus to attack and damage rolls becomes +2 at 15th level.

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Gauntlets

item: A pair of gloves or gauntlets (requires attunement)

entries: These magical gauntlets have 4 charges. When the wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can expend 1 charge and force the target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 15 feet. The gauntlets regain all expended charges at dawn.
At 9th level this magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 15th level.

optionalfeature.name: Skyfall Harness
entries: This magic harness automatically sizes to fit the wearer, and can be worn over clothing or light armor. It has wing-like fins between your limbs that can slow your fall or allow you to glide. When you fall, and aren't incapacitated, you subtract up to 100 feet from your fall when calculating falling damage, and can move 2 feet horizontally every 1 foot you fall.

optionalfeature.name: War Gauntlet

item: An armored gauntlet and a martial weapon or shield

entries: You attach either a martial weapon lacking the heavy or two handed properties, or a shield to the gauntlet. The wearer gains proficiency with the attached item, and it cannot be removed from the gauntlet while this Infusion is active.

optionalfeature.name: Chameleon Armor
entries: This armor has 4 charges. While wearing this magical armor the wearer can use an action to expend charges and cast one of the following spells, targeting only themselves: {@spell invisibility} (2 charges) or {@spell greater invisibility} (4 charges). This armor regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Collar of Taming
entries: The magic of this collar can tame even the wildest of animals. You, and only you, can control any beast wearing this collar as if it were a trained mount. This collar does not work on beasts with an Intelligence score greater than your own.
At 15th level, this magic collar allows you to control any monstrosity with an Intelligence score of 5 or lower.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Weapon
entries: You infuse a weapon with elemental energy. Upon infusion, choose a command word and one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. As a bonus action, the wielder can speak the command word and cause elemental energy to burst forth from the weapon until the command word is spoken again. On hit, the weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d4} of the elemental damage.
The additional damage becomes {@dice 1d6} at 14th level.

optionalfeature.name: Metamorphosis Armor
entries: This magic suit of armor has 4 charges. As an action, the wearer can expend a charge to cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell, targeting only themselves, without expending a spell slot or requiring concentration. Re-casting the spell with the armor ends the effect. This armor regains all charges at dawn.

optionalfeature.name: Ring of the Elements
entries: Upon infusing this magic ring you select one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, lightning, or thunder.
When the wearer casts a spell that deals the damage type that you selected, they can activate this ring to deal maximum damage to one target of the spell instead of rolling.
Once this ring is activated it cannot be used again until the wearer completes a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric Weapon
entries: You enchant a weapon to drain life from enemies. When the wielder scores a critical hit with this weapon, the target takes an additional {@dice 2d6} necrotic damage, so long as the target is not a construct or undead. The wielder gains temporary hit points equal to the extra necrotic damage dealt.
When you reach 14th level, the additional necrotic damage from this Infusion increases to {@dice 4d6}.

optionalfeature.name: Helm of Mind Shielding

item: A helm, hat, or diadem (requires attunement)

entries: The wearer of this magic helm is resistant to psychic damage, immune to the charmed and frightened conditions, and any magic that allows another creature to read their thoughts or telepathically communicate with them.

optionalfeature.name: Masterwork Homunculus
entries: You have discovered the secrets to the creation of life. You learn the {@spell clone} spell. It counts as an artificer spell for you, but it doesn't count against your number of Spells Known. You can cast {@spell clone} without expending a spell slot as long as you have the material components available.
If you replace this Infusion with another at any point during the incubation period, the spell immediately fails.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Armament
entries: This item has 4 charges. While wielding this magic weapon, the user can use their action to cast the {@spell steel wind strike|xge} spell, using the Infused weapon as the spellcasting focus, without expending a spell slot. The weapon regains all expended charges at the end of a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Shot
entries: While wielding this magic weapon, the user can use their action to cast {@spell swift quiver}, using the Infused weapon as the spellcasting focus, without expending a spell slot.
Once activated, the wielder must finish a short or long rest before they can cast {@spell swift quiver} with this weapon again.
